active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the top three OWASP API Security Top 10 risks for third-party APIs (e.g., Broken Authentication, BOLA, Unrestricted Resource Consumption) and propose tailored monitoring strategies for each, considering real-world examples like supply chain attacks.
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student explains Third-Party Risk Management (TPRM) using a real-world example such as the SolarWinds supply chain attack involving third-party APIs; then switch roles and have the partner quiz the explainer on key monitoring controls.
active_learning.problem_solving: Scenario: A company integrates a third-party payment API (e.g., Stripe). Identify monitoring gaps (e.g., SSRF vulnerabilities), simulate an attack vector like excessive rate limiting bypass, and design a detection dashboard with logging, alerting, and anomaly detection.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Generate 25 high-quality flashcards on 'Third-Party API Monitoring' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > 006_API Security > 008_Third-Party and Integration Security > Third-Party 006_API Security > Third-Party API Monitoring). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: Embed prompts/scenarios (e.g., OWASP debate, payment API problem-solving). - Scaffolding: 4 Layers [INSERT FULL DETAILS FROM ABOVE]. - Research Context: OWASP API Top 10 (BOLA, Broken Auth, etc.), TPRM, tools (Kong, SIEM), best practices (monitor broken auth, rate limiting, logging, alerting, anomaly detection, vendor assessments). - Voter Consensus: Completeness (full best practices), pedagogy (measurable objectives, misconceptions like 'HTTPS=secure'). Output ONLY valid JSON array of flashcards, each matching this schema: { "id": 1, "type": "Basic" or "MCQ", "bloom_level": "REMEMBER" etc., "scaffolding_layer": 1-4, "front": {question or term}, "back": {answer, explanation, correct_answer if MCQ, distractor_rationale}, "active_learning_tie": "e.g., Discussion on OWASP risks" } Ensure distractors from protocol, measurable outcomes, web-grounded (OWASP/NIST). Cover all objectives progressively.
